title: Cabernet & Flatbread Tasting
description:
Join us on Saturday, February 21, from 1–3 PM at Whispering Vine Fourth Street for an extraordinary afternoon dedicated to Napa Valley and West Coast Cabernet Sauvignon, featuring a rare lineup of iconic producers and benchmark bottlings, paired with freshly prepared flatbread.

Tasting Fee: $85 per person (Includes flatbread and a tasting of all featured wines)

Limited to 50 guests

Reserve your Spot

Featured Wines:

• Silver Oak Alexander Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2018 – 94 pts James Suckling, 93 pts Wine Spectator – Polished and expressive with ripe blackberry, cassis, sweet oak, cedar, and a long, savory finish.

• Groth Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon 2021 – 96 pts Wine Spectator, 95 pts Robert Parker’s Wine Advocate – Sleek and age-worthy, delivering pure cassis, blackberry, licorice, cedar, and wet slate with remarkable precision and length.

• Anthem Mt. Veeder Estate Cabernet Sauvignon 2019 – Powerful and mountain-driven with dark cherry, blackberry, olive, bay leaf, espresso, and a long, structured finish.

• Paul Hobbs Coombsville Cabernet Sauvignon 2022 – 96 pts James Suckling, 94 pts Decanter – Layered and refined with cherry, cassis, violets, savory spice, and silky tannins framed by cool-climate freshness.

• Caymus Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2023 – Lush and signature in style, offering deep color, ripe berry fruit, cocoa, and supple, approachable tannins.

• Justin Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon 2022 – Concentrated and structured with blackberry, cassis, espresso, cedar, and a long, polished finish.

• Heitz Cellar Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2021 – 99 pts Decanter – Remarkably pure and tightly focused with pristine black fruit, violet aromatics, and mineral-driven tannins built for longevity.

• Adaptation by Odette Cabernet Sauvignon 2019 – Seamless and elegant with blackberry, crème de cassis, cocoa, espresso, and impressive balance.

• Faust Cabernet Sauvignon 2023 – Bold yet refined with Luxardo cherry, blueberry compote, dark cocoa, forest floor, and fine-grained tannins.

• Clos du Val Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2022 – 96 pts Tasting Panel – Sleek and impeccably balanced with plum, black olive, slate, fig, and savory tea notes.

• Turnbull Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2023 – Fresh and vibrant with red plum, blackberry compote, sagebrush, baking spice, and lively acidity.

An unparalleled opportunity to taste an elite collection of Cabernet Sauvignons side by side—a must-attend event for serious Cabernet lovers and collectors alike.
